tool.name: StreamNetworktoRAPID

param.name: rapid_out_folder
param.dialogReference: This is the directory where the output RAPID files and weight tables will be stored for the stream network.

param.name: input_Drainage_Lines
param.dialogReference: A stream network with unique IDs and a field with the uniqe ID of the next downstream segment.

param.name: Stream_ID_DrainageLine
param.dialogReference: This is the fiekl containing the uniqe ID for the stream network segments.

param.name: Next_Down_ID
param.dialogReference: This is the field containing the unique ID of the next downstream segment.

param.name: length_field_DrainageLine
param.dialogReference: This is the field with the lenght attribute of the stream segment in Kilometers.

param.name: Slope_field_DrainageLine
param.dialogReference: This is the field with the slope attribute of the stream segment.

param.name: Catchment_Features
param.dialogReference:
These are the input catchments to generate the weight table files for the Streamflow Prediction Tool. Since they are optional, if they are not included, the weight table files will not be generated.

The weight tables generated include the High Resolution (T1279) and Low Resolution (TCO639) forecast grids as well as the ERA Interim grid (T511). More information about the weight tables can be found here:

Snow, Alan D., Scott D. Christensen, Nathan R. Swain, E. James Nelson, Daniel P. Ames, Norman L. Jones, Deng Ding, Nawajish S. Noman, Cedric H. David, Florian Pappenberger, and Ervin Zsoter, 2016. A High-Resolution National-Scale Hydrologic Forecast System from a Global Ensemble Land Surface Model. Journal of the American Water Resources Association (JAWRA) 1-15, DOI: 10.1111/1752-1688.12434

param.name: Stream_ID_Catchments
param.dialogReference: The uniqe ID of the stream segment associated with the catchments.

param.name: Input_Reservoirs
param.dialogReference: This is a shapefile with reservoirs covering the area of interest. If these are included, the value of Muksingum X for the stream segments that intersect with the reservoirs in the shapefile will be set to "0".

tool.summary:
This converts a stream network to the necessary files for RAPID. For more information, go to rapid-hub.org.

David, Cédric H., David R. Maidment, Guo-Yue Niu, Zong- Liang Yang, Florence Habets and Victor Eijkhout (2011), River network routing on the NHDPlus dataset, Journal of Hydrometeorology, 12(5), 913-934. DOI: 10.1175/2011JHM1345.1
tool.usage:
A stream network with unique IDs and a field with the uniqe ID of the next downstream segment. will serve as the input to this script (NOTE: The DEM to Stream Network tool can generate this for you). If you desire to generate the weight tables for the Streamflow Prediction Tool, then catchments with the unique ID of the assocated stream network will be required.

There is an optional feature which will correct the Muskingum X value for the segment of the stream network to 0 instead of 0.3 if the segment intersects with a reservoir.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This converts a stream network to the necessary files for RAPID. For more information, go to rapid-hub.org.

David, Cédric H., David R. Maidment, Guo-Yue Niu, Zong- Liang Yang, Florence Habets and Victor Eijkhout (2011), River network routing on the NHDPlus dataset, Journal of Hydrometeorology, 12(5), 913-934. DOI: 10.1175/2011JHM1345.1
